intro: Melodorum korthalsii, commonly known as the African violet, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and thrives in well-draining soil. Its flowers are often brightly colored, ranging from white to violet, and are attractively shaped to encourage pollination by insects. Melodorum korthalsii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
